		</div>

			<label for="pokemonBlue">Blue</label>
		</div>

Property Accordion

  • Eligibility Income, occupancy, preferences, and subsidies
    Eligibility Income, occupancy, preferences, and subsidies

    Household Maximum Income

    For income calculations, household size includes everyone (all ages) living in the unit.

    • Starts at $3,245 /month
      based on household size
    household size maximum income/month maximum income/year
    1 person $3,245/month $38,950/year
    2 person $3,708/month $44,500/year
    3 person $4,204/month $50,450/year
    4 person $4,670/month $56,050/year
    5 person $5,045/month $60,550/year
    6 person $5,416/month $65,000/year

    Occupancy

    Occupancy for this building differs from household size and does not include children under 6.

    • Studio
    • 1-2 people
    • 1 Bedroom
    • 1-3 people
    • 2 Bedroom
    • 2-4 people
    • 3 Bedroom
    • 3-6 people

    Lottery Preferences

    Preference holders will be given highest ranking in the lottery process.

    Certificate of Preference

    Certificate of Preference holders are primarily households displaced by Agency action in Redevelopment Project Areas during the 1960s and 1970s, but may also include other persons displaced by Agency action.

    Displaced Tenants Housing Preference (Ellis Act)

    Displaced Tenant Housing Preference Certificate holders are people whose landlord filed a Notice of Intent to Withdraw with the San Francisco Rent Board (Ellis Act) or have been evicted from a rental unit due to an owner move in (OMI) eviction. Please note that housing developments using state funds do not recognize this preference.

    Live/Work Preference

    Households that live or work in San Francisco will be given third highest preference in the lottery ranking process.

    Rental Assistance

    Section 8 housing vouchers and other valid rental assistance programs can be used for this property.

    In the case of a valid rental subsidy, the required minimum income will be based on the portion of the rent that the tenant pays after use of the subsidy.

    Additional Eligibility Rules

    Applicants must also qualify under the rules of the building.

    Credit Rating

    A credit report will be obtained on each applicant after their eligibility for the Inclusionary BMR program has been determined.

    Renter's History

    Applicants with an eviction by a previous landlord, for cause, within the last 7 years will be rejected.

    Criminal History

    Criminal reports are not ordered or reviewed until credit history has been ordered and scored with an approval rating.

  • Process Important dates and contact information

    How to Apply

    Pickup and turn in application

    Caritas Management Corporation

    1358 Valencia St,
    San Francisco, CA 94102

    Get Directions

    Office Hours

    8:30 am—5:00pm

    Download Application

    Contact Leasing Agent

    Sophia Sidhu

    Affordable Leasing Administrator

    Call 415-928-5910

    Due to high call volume you may hear recorded message

    Application Deadline

    November 21, 2015

    Information Sessions

      1:00pm–2:30pm

      San Francisco LGBT Community Center

      1800 Market Street, San Francisco

    Open Houses

    • October 10, 2015

      1:00pm–2:30pm

    • October 18, 2015

      1:00pm–2:30pm

    Public Lottery

    • November 28, 2015

      1:00pm–2:30pm

      San Francisco LGBT Community Center

      1800 Market Street, San Francisco

  • Legal Required documents and selection criteria
    Legal Required documents and selection criteria
    Required Documents

    Ellis Act Housing Preference holders are primarily households displaced by Ellis Act evictions as defined by The Ellis Act Displacement Emergency Assistance Ordinance passed into law on December 18, 2013.

    Legal Disclaimers

    Households that live or work in San Francisco will be given third highest preference in the lottery ranking process.

    Smoking Policy

    Households that live or work in San Francisco will be given third highest preference in the lottery ranking process.

    Pets Policy

    Households that live or work in San Francisco will be given third highest preference in the lottery ranking process.

              </span>        </a>

            Required Documents
            <span class="ui-control ui-icon ui-small">
              <svg>

					<div id="panel1a-b" class="content">
						<p>Ellis Act Housing Preference holders are primarily households displaced by Ellis Act evictions as defined by The Ellis Act Displacement Emergency Assistance Ordinance passed into law on December 18, 2013.</p>

Property Accordion Dl

Eligibility Income, occupancy, preferences and rental assistance
Eligibility Income, occupancy, preferences, rental assistance and additional building rules

Household Maximum Income

For income calculations, household size includes everyone (all ages) living in the unit.

  • Starts at $3,245 /month
    based on household size
household size maximum income/month maximum income/year
1 person $3,245/month $38,950/year
2 person $3,708/month $44,500/year
3 person $4,204/month $50,450/year
4 person $4,670/month $56,050/year
5 person $5,045/month $60,550/year
6 person $5,416/month $65,000/year

Occupancy

Occupancy for this building differs from household size and does not include children under 6.

  • Studio
  • 1-2 people
  • 1 Bedroom
  • 1-3 people
  • 2 Bedroom
  • 2-4 people
  • 3 Bedroom
  • 3-6 people

Lottery Preferences

Preference holders will be given highest ranking in the lottery process.

Certificate of Preference

Certificate of Preference holders are primarily households displaced by Agency action in Redevelopment Project Areas during the 1960s and 1970s, but may also include other persons displaced by Agency action.

Displaced Tenants Housing Preference (Ellis Act)

Displaced Tenant Housing Preference Certificate holders are people whose landlord filed a Notice of Intent to Withdraw with the San Francisco Rent Board (Ellis Act) or have been evicted from a rental unit due to an owner move in (OMI) eviction. Please note that housing developments using state funds do not recognize this preference.

Live/Work Preference

Households that live or work in San Francisco will be given third highest preference in the lottery ranking process.

Rental Assistance

Section 8 housing vouchers and other valid rental assistance programs can be used for this property.

In the case of a valid rental subsidy, the required minimum income will be based on the portion of the rent that the tenant pays after use of the subsidy.

Additional Eligibility Rules

Applicants must also qualify under the rules of the building.

Credit Rating

A credit report will be obtained on each applicant after their eligibility for the Inclusionary BMR program has been determined.

Renter's History

Applicants with an eviction by a previous landlord, for cause, within the last 7 years will be rejected.

Criminal History

Criminal reports are not ordered or reviewed until credit history has been ordered and scored with an approval rating.

Important Program Rules Required documents and policies
Required Documents

Ellis Act Housing Preference holders are primarily households displaced by Ellis Act evictions as defined by The Ellis Act Displacement Emergency Assistance Ordinance passed into law on December 18, 2013.

Legal Disclaimers

Households that live or work in San Francisco will be given third highest preference in the lottery ranking process.

Smoking Policy

Households that live or work in San Francisco will be given third highest preference in the lottery ranking process.

Pets Policy

Households that live or work in San Francisco will be given third highest preference in the lottery ranking process.

Results Lottery selection, important dates and contact

Applications Closed

Lottery Results

  • Rank Ticket
  • 1 843219
  • 1 843219
  • 1 843219
  • 1 843219

Out of 50 applications, 20 numbers were pulled.

What to Expect

Applicants will be contacted by the leasing agent in lottery rank order until vacancies are filled.

All of the information that you have provided must be verified, and your eligibility confirmed. Any fraudulent statements will cause your application to be removed from the lottery. You will also be removed from the lottery if you cannot prove a housing preference, or if a household member appears on more than one application.

Should your application be chosen from the lottery, be prepared to fill out a more detailed application and provide required supporting documents.

read more

Contact Leasing Agent

Sophia Sidhu

Affordable Leasing Administrator

Call 415-928-5910

Due to high call valume you may hear a message

Email
Eligibility Income, occupancy, preferences, and subsidies
Eligibility Income, occupancy, preferences, and subsidies

Household Maximum Income

For income calculations, household size includes everyone (all ages) living in the unit.

  • Starts at $3,245 /month
    based on household size
household size maximum income/month maximum income/year
1 person $3,245/month $38,950/year
2 person $3,708/month $44,500/year
3 person $4,204/month $50,450/year
4 person $4,670/month $56,050/year
5 person $5,045/month $60,550/year
6 person $5,416/month $65,000/year

Occupancy

Occupancy for this building differs from household size and does not include children under 6.

  • Studio
  • 1-2 people
  • 1 Bedroom
  • 1-3 people
  • 2 Bedroom
  • 2-4 people
  • 3 Bedroom
  • 3-6 people

Lottery Preferences

Preference holders will be given highest ranking in the lottery process.

Certificate of Preference

Certificate of Preference holders are primarily households displaced by Agency action in Redevelopment Project Areas during the 1960s and 1970s, but may also include other persons displaced by Agency action.

Displaced Tenants Housing Preference (Ellis Act)

Displaced Tenant Housing Preference Certificate holders are people whose landlord filed a Notice of Intent to Withdraw with the San Francisco Rent Board (Ellis Act) or have been evicted from a rental unit due to an owner move in (OMI) eviction. Please note that housing developments using state funds do not recognize this preference.

Live/Work Preference

Households that live or work in San Francisco will be given third highest preference in the lottery ranking process.

Rental Assistance

Section 8 housing vouchers and other valid rental assistance programs can be used for this property.

In the case of a valid rental subsidy, the required minimum income will be based on the portion of the rent that the tenant pays after use of the subsidy.

Additional Eligibility Rules

Applicants must also qualify under the rules of the building.

Credit Rating

A credit report will be obtained on each applicant after their eligibility for the Inclusionary BMR program has been determined.

Renter's History

Applicants with an eviction by a previous landlord, for cause, within the last 7 years will be rejected.

Criminal History

Criminal reports are not ordered or reviewed until credit history has been ordered and scored with an approval rating.

Legal Required documents and selection criteria
Legal Required documents and selection criteria
Required Documents

Ellis Act Housing Preference holders are primarily households displaced by Ellis Act evictions as defined by The Ellis Act Displacement Emergency Assistance Ordinance passed into law on December 18, 2013.

Legal Disclaimers

Households that live or work in San Francisco will be given third highest preference in the lottery ranking process.

Smoking Policy

Households that live or work in San Francisco will be given third highest preference in the lottery ranking process.

Pets Policy

Households that live or work in San Francisco will be given third highest preference in the lottery ranking process.

Property Accordion Post Results Modal

Results Lottery selection, important dates and contact

Applications Closed

Lottery Results

December 17, 2015

A total of 900 tickets were drawn in this lottery.

View Lottery Results

What to Expect

Applicants will be contacted by the leasing agent in lottery rank order until vacancies are filled.

All of the information that you have provided must be verified, and your eligibility confirmed. Any fraudulent statements will cause your application to be removed from the lottery. You will also be removed from the lottery if you cannot prove a housing preference, or if a household member appears on more than one application.

Should your application be chosen from the lottery, be prepared to fill out a more detailed application and provide required supporting documents.

read more

Contact Leasing Agent

Sophia Sidhu

Affordable Leasing Administrator

Call (415) 928-5910

Due to high call valume you may hear a message

Email
Eligibility Income, occupancy, preferences, and subsidies
Eligibility Income, occupancy, preferences, and subsidies

Household Maximum Income

For income calculations, household size includes everyone (all ages) living in the unit.

  • Starts at $3,245 /month
    based on household size
household size maximum income/month maximum income/year
1 person $3,245/month $38,950/year
2 person $3,708/month $44,500/year
3 person $4,204/month $50,450/year
4 person $4,670/month $56,050/year
5 person $5,045/month $60,550/year
6 person $5,416/month $65,000/year

Occupancy

Occupancy for this building differs from household size and does not include children under 6.

  • Studio
  • 1-2 people
  • 1 Bedroom
  • 1-3 people
  • 2 Bedroom
  • 2-4 people
  • 3 Bedroom
  • 3-6 people

Lottery Preferences

Preference holders will be given highest ranking in the lottery process.

Certificate of Preference

Certificate of Preference holders are primarily households displaced by Agency action in Redevelopment Project Areas during the 1960s and 1970s, but may also include other persons displaced by Agency action.

Displaced Tenants Housing Preference (Ellis Act)

Displaced Tenant Housing Preference Certificate holders are people whose landlord filed a Notice of Intent to Withdraw with the San Francisco Rent Board (Ellis Act) or have been evicted from a rental unit due to an owner move in (OMI) eviction. Please note that housing developments using state funds do not recognize this preference.

Live/Work Preference

Households that live or work in San Francisco will be given third highest preference in the lottery ranking process.

Rental Assistance

Section 8 housing vouchers and other valid rental assistance programs can be used for this property.

In the case of a valid rental subsidy, the required minimum income will be based on the portion of the rent that the tenant pays after use of the subsidy.

Additional Eligibility Rules

Applicants must also qualify under the rules of the building.

Credit Rating

A credit report will be obtained on each applicant after their eligibility for the Inclusionary BMR program has been determined.

Renter's History

Applicants with an eviction by a previous landlord, for cause, within the last 7 years will be rejected.

Criminal History

Criminal reports are not ordered or reviewed until credit history has been ordered and scored with an approval rating.

Legal Required documents and selection criteria
Legal Required documents and selection criteria
Required Documents

Ellis Act Housing Preference holders are primarily households displaced by Ellis Act evictions as defined by The Ellis Act Displacement Emergency Assistance Ordinance passed into law on December 18, 2013.

Legal Disclaimers

Households that live or work in San Francisco will be given third highest preference in the lottery ranking process.

Smoking Policy

Households that live or work in San Francisco will be given third highest preference in the lottery ranking process.

Pets Policy

Households that live or work in San Francisco will be given third highest preference in the lottery ranking process.

			<div class="content-panel lined">
				<header class="margin-bottom">
					<h4 class="t-epsilon t-sans margin-bottom--half">Lottery Preferences</h4>
					<p class="t-tiny c-steel">Preference holders will be given highest ranking in the lottery process.</p>
				</header>
				<dl class="accordion-nested accordion trigger-left" data-accordion>
					<dd class="accordion-navigation">
						<a href="#panel1a-a" class="accordion-header">
              Certificate of Preference 
              <span class="ui-control ui-icon ui-small">
                <svg>
                  <use xlink:href="#i-arrow-down"></use>
                </svg>
              </span>        </a>
						<div id="panel1a-a" class="content">
							<p>Certificate of Preference holders are primarily households displaced by Agency action in Redevelopment Project Areas during the 1960s and 1970s, but may also include other persons displaced by Agency action.</p>
						</div>
					</dd>
					<dd class="accordion-navigation">
						<a href="#panel1a-b" class="accordion-header">
              Displaced Tenants Housing Preference (Ellis Act)
              <span class="ui-control ui-icon ui-small">
                <svg>
                  <use xlink:href="#i-arrow-down"></use>
                </svg>
              </span>        </a>
						<div id="panel1a-b" class="content">
							<p>Displaced Tenant Housing Preference Certificate holders are people whose landlord filed a Notice of Intent to Withdraw with the San Francisco Rent Board (Ellis Act) or have been evicted from a rental unit due to an owner move in (OMI) eviction.
								Please note that housing developments using state funds do not recognize this preference.</p>
						</div>
					</dd>
					<dd class="accordion-navigation">
						<a href="#panel1a-c" class="accordion-header">
              Live/Work Preference
              <span class="ui-control ui-icon ui-small">
                <svg>
                  <use xlink:href="#i-arrow-down"></use>
                </svg>
              </span>        </a>
						<div id="panel1a-c" class="content">
							<p>Households that live or work in San Francisco will be given third highest preference in the lottery ranking process.</p>
						</div>
					</dd>
				</dl>
			</div>

			<div class="content-panel lined">
				<header class="panel-header" data-equalizer-watch>
					<h4 class="t-epsilon t-sans no-margin">Rental Assistance</h4>
					<p class="t-small c-steel">Section 8 housing vouchers and other valid rental assistance programs can be used for this property.</p>
				</header>

				<p class="t-small c-steel">In the case of a valid rental subsidy, the required minimum income will be based on the portion of the rent that the tenant pays after use of the subsidy.</p>
			</div>

			<div class="content-panel">
				<header class="margin-bottom">
					<h4 class="t-epsilon t-sans no-margin">Additional Eligibility Rules</h4>
					<p class="t-small c-steel">Applicants must also qualify under the rules of the building.</p>
				</header>

				<dl class="accordion-nested accordion trigger-left" data-accordion>
					<dd class="accordion-navigation">
						<a href="#panel2a-a" class="accordion-header">
              Credit Rating 
              <span class="ui-control ui-icon ui-small">
                <svg>
                  <use xlink:href="#i-arrow-down"></use>
                </svg>
              </span>        </a>
						<div id="panel2a-a" class="content">
							<p>A credit report will be obtained on each applicant after their eligibility for the Inclusionary BMR program has been determined.</p>
						</div>
					</dd>
					<dd class="accordion-navigation">
						<a href="#panel2a-b" class="accordion-header">
              Renter's History 
              <span class="ui-control ui-icon ui-small">
                <svg>
                  <use xlink:href="#i-arrow-down"></use>
                </svg>
              </span>        </a>
						<div id="panel2a-b" class="content">
							<p>Applicants with an eviction by a previous landlord, for cause, within the last 7 years will be rejected.</p>
						</div>
					</dd>
					<dd class="accordion-navigation">
						<a href="#panel2a-c" class="accordion-header">
              Criminal History
              <span class="ui-control ui-icon ui-small">
                <svg>
                  <use xlink:href="#i-arrow-down"></use>
                </svg>
              </span>        </a>
						<div id="panel2a-c" class="content">
							<p>Criminal reports are not ordered or reviewed until credit history has been ordered and scored with an approval rating.</p>
						</div>
					</dd>
				</dl>
			</div>
		</div>
	</dd>

Property Accordion Pre Lottery

Results Lottery selection, important dates and contact

Applications Closed

Lottery

October 28, 2015

1:00pm&ndash2:30pm

San Francisco LGBT Community Center

1800 Market Street, San Francisco

An open lottery will be held to draw numbers to determine selection. Attendence is optional.

Lottery Results

November 21, 2015

Complete lottery results will be posted here by 5pm.

What to Expect

Applicants will be contacted by the leasing agent in lottery rank order until vacancies are filled.

All of the information that you have provided must be verified, and your eligibility confirmed. Any fraudulent statements will cause your application to be removed from the lottery. You will also be removed from the lottery if you cannot prove a housing preference, or if a household member appears on more than one application.

Should your application be chosen from the lottery, be prepared to fill out a more detailed application and provide required supporting documents.

read more

Contact Leasing Agent

Sophia Sidhu

Affordable Leasing Administrator

Call 415-928-5910

Due to high call valume you may hear a message

Email
Eligibility Income, occupancy, preferences, and subsidies
Eligibility Income, occupancy, preferences, and subsidies

Household Maximum Income

For income calculations, household size includes everyone (all ages) living in the unit.

  • Starts at $3,245 /month
    based on household size
household size maximum income/month maximum income/year
1 person $3,245/month $38,950/year
2 person $3,708/month $44,500/year
3 person $4,204/month $50,450/year
4 person $4,670/month $56,050/year
5 person $5,045/month $60,550/year
6 person $5,416/month $65,000/year

Occupancy

Occupancy for this building differs from household size and does not include children under 6.

  • Studio
  • 1-2 people
  • 1 Bedroom
  • 1-3 people
  • 2 Bedroom
  • 2-4 people
  • 3 Bedroom
  • 3-6 people

Lottery Preferences

Preference holders will be given highest ranking in the lottery process.

Certificate of Preference

Certificate of Preference holders are primarily households displaced by Agency action in Redevelopment Project Areas during the 1960s and 1970s, but may also include other persons displaced by Agency action.

Displaced Tenants Housing Preference (Ellis Act)

Displaced Tenant Housing Preference Certificate holders are people whose landlord filed a Notice of Intent to Withdraw with the San Francisco Rent Board (Ellis Act) or have been evicted from a rental unit due to an owner move in (OMI) eviction. Please note that housing developments using state funds do not recognize this preference.

Live/Work Preference

Households that live or work in San Francisco will be given third highest preference in the lottery ranking process.

Rental Assistance

Section 8 housing vouchers and other valid rental assistance programs can be used for this property.

In the case of a valid rental subsidy, the required minimum income will be based on the portion of the rent that the tenant pays after use of the subsidy.

Additional Eligibility Rules

Applicants must also qualify under the rules of the building.

Credit Rating

A credit report will be obtained on each applicant after their eligibility for the Inclusionary BMR program has been determined.

Renter's History

Applicants with an eviction by a previous landlord, for cause, within the last 7 years will be rejected.

Criminal History

Criminal reports are not ordered or reviewed until credit history has been ordered and scored with an approval rating.

							<p>Displaced Tenant Housing Preference Certificate holders are people whose landlord filed a Notice of Intent to Withdraw with the San Francisco Rent Board (Ellis Act) or have been evicted from a rental unit due to an owner move in (OMI) eviction.
								Please note that housing developments using state funds do not recognize this preference.</p>
						</div>
					</dd>
					<dd class="accordion-navigation">
						<a href="#panel1a-c" class="accordion-header">
              Live/Work Preference
              <span class="ui-control ui-icon ui-small">
                <svg>
                  <use xlink:href="#i-arrow-down"></use>
                </svg>
              </span>        </a>
						<div id="panel1a-c" class="content">
							<p>Households that live or work in San Francisco will be given third highest preference in the lottery ranking process.</p>
						</div>
					</dd>
				</dl>
			</div>

			<div class="content-panel lined">
				<header class="panel-header" data-equalizer-watch>
					<h4 class="t-epsilon t-sans no-margin">Rental Assistance</h4>
					<p class="t-small c-steel">Section 8 housing vouchers and other valid rental assistance programs can be used for this property.</p>
				</header>

				<p class="t-small c-steel">In the case of a valid rental subsidy, the required minimum income will be based on the portion of the rent that the tenant pays after use of the subsidy.</p>
			</div>

			<div class="content-panel">
				<header class="margin-bottom">
					<h4 class="t-epsilon t-sans no-margin">Additional Eligibility Rules</h4>
					<p class="t-small c-steel">Applicants must also qualify under the rules of the building.</p>
				</header>

				<dl class="accordion-nested accordion trigger-left" data-accordion>
					<dd class="accordion-navigation">
						<a href="#panel2a-a" class="accordion-header">
              Credit Rating

                </svg>
              </span>        </a>

							<p>A credit report will be obtained on each applicant after their eligibility for the Inclusionary BMR program has been determined.</p>
						</div>
					</dd>

Property Accordion Pre Results

Results Lottery selection, important dates and contact

Applications Closed

Lottery Results

Nov 21st

Complete lottery results will be posted here by 5pm.

What to Expect

Applicants will be contacted by the leasing agent in lottery rank order until vacancies are filled.

All of the information that you have provided must be verified, and your eligibility confirmed. Any fraudulent statements will cause your application to be removed from the lottery. You will also be removed from the lottery if you cannot prove a housing preference, or if a household member appears on more than one application.

Should your application be chosen from the lottery, be prepared to fill out a more detailed application and provide required supporting documents.

read more

Eligibility Income, occupancy, preferences, and subsidies

Household Maximum Income

For income calculations, household size includes everyone (all ages) living in the unit.

  • Starts at $3,245 /month
    based on household size
household size maximum income/month maximum income/year
1 person $3,245/month $38,950/year
2 person $3,708/month $44,500/year
3 person $4,204/month $50,450/year
4 person $4,670/month $56,050/year
5 person $5,045/month $60,550/year
6 person $5,416/month $65,000/year

Occupancy

Occupancy for this building differs from household size and does not include children under 6.

  • Studio
  • 1-2 people
  • 1 Bedroom
  • 1-3 people
  • 2 Bedroom
  • 2-4 people
  • 3 Bedroom
  • 3-6 people

Lottery Preferences

Preference holders will be given highest ranking in the lottery process.

Certificate of Preference

Certificate of Preference holders are primarily households displaced by Agency action in Redevelopment Project Areas during the 1960s and 1970s, but may also include other persons displaced by Agency action.

Displaced Tenants Housing Preference (Ellis Act)

Displaced Tenant Housing Preference Certificate holders are people whose landlord filed a Notice of Intent to Withdraw with the San Francisco Rent Board (Ellis Act) or have been evicted from a rental unit due to an owner move in (OMI) eviction. Please note that housing developments using state funds do not recognize this preference.

Live/Work Preference

Households that live or work in San Francisco will be given third highest preference in the lottery ranking process.

Rental Assistance

Section 8 housing vouchers and other valid rental assistance programs can be used for this property.

In the case of a valid rental subsidy, the required minimum income will be based on the portion of the rent that the tenant pays after use of the subsidy.

Additional Eligibility Rules

Applicants must also qualify under the rules of the building.

Credit Rating

A credit report will be obtained on each applicant after their eligibility for the Inclusionary BMR program has been determined.

Renter's History

Applicants with an eviction by a previous landlord, for cause, within the last 7 years will be rejected.

Criminal History

Criminal reports are not ordered or reviewed until credit history has been ordered and scored with an approval rating.

Legal Required documents and selection criteria
Legal Required documents and selection criteria
Required Documents

Ellis Act Housing Preference holders are primarily households displaced by Ellis Act evictions as defined by The Ellis Act Displacement Emergency Assistance Ordinance passed into law on December 18, 2013.

Legal Disclaimers

Households that live or work in San Francisco will be given third highest preference in the lottery ranking process.

Smoking Policy

Households that live or work in San Francisco will be given third highest preference in the lottery ranking process.

Pets Policy

Households that live or work in San Francisco will be given third highest preference in the lottery ranking process.
